div.p: CIVIL MAGISTRACY BY DIVINE AUTHORITY, Aſſerted, and laid forth In a SERMON, Preached at the Aſſiſes holden at Wincheſter, for the County of South-Hampton, on Thurſday the 4th day of March, 1651/52.
Afterward, the ſame Subject much enlarged, and in ſome particulars more cleared, and applyed, on the like occaſion, at Taunton in Somerſet, on Sunday in the Aſſize week, Aug. 22. 1652.
By WILLIAM SCLATER, Doctor in Divinity, Preacher of the Word of God in Broadſtreet, London.
div.q: ROM. 13.1. Let every ſoul be ſubject unto the Higher Powers; for there is no power but of God: the Powers that be are ordained of God.

Non ſine gravi conſilio Apoſtolus [abſtractivâ] locutione uti voluit, ut oſtenderet Subditos non debere ad Perſonas Imperantium reſpicere; ſed ad ipſorum Officium, & ad Poteſtatem, quâ divini • ùs ſunt inſtructi: Quos enim Apoſtolus hoc loco vocat 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 , eos Chriſtus appellat 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 , Luc. 22. ver. 25. Joh. Gerard. Loc. Com. Tom. 6. cap. 1. §. 8.
